name: Patagonia Inc

animals.info: Primary Animal Derived Materials used by the company are wool and down. All Patagonia down products contain only 100% Advance Global Traceable Down Standard down. The company have also introduced a range that utilise recycled down. Although Patagonia uses merino wool, which often involves muelsing, the company stated on its website that 'All virgin wool used in Patagonia products is sourced under the strict guidelines of the Responsible Wool Standard (RWS)'.

pledges: By 2025, all  apparel products will be made from 100% recycled, reclaimed or renewable resources.
To be carbon neutral across entire business including our supply chain by 2025
By 2025, all packaging will be 100% reusable, home compostable, renewable, or easily recyclable.
By 2030, 100% of the cotton and hemp fiber used will be Regenerative Organic Certified (ROC).
environment.info: All of the cotton the company uses is organic, and it makes use of hemp and recycled materials such as recycled nylon, polyester and down. The company also uses a repair service.

labour.info: The company was named in a report titled 'Global Supply Chains, Forced Labor, and the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region [XUAR]' where it was allegedly 'suspected of directly employing forced labor or sourcing from suppliers that are suspected of using forced labor'. The company have since stated that they are actively exiting the Xinjiang region, in accordance with with the Fair Labor Association (FLA).

philanthropy.info: The company has donated 1% of its sales as environmental grants through the '1% for the Planet' scheme, for over 30 years.

animals.info: Although OTB SpA states that 'any technique to obtain plumes and feathers from live animals are prohibited' for it's companies, the company has not adopted a standard for sourcing down. Diesel also do not disclose whether their fragrance production involves animal testing. Because of this, it cannot be considered cruelty-free, as per PETA's standard.

environment.info: The company does not report on it's Scope 1, Scope 2 or Scope 3 emissions, or whether they have any targets in line with international agreements. The company also scored 0/100 in WWF, Pesticide Action Network UK and Solidaridad's published report regarding the cotton sector and its sustainability

labour.info: Supply chain not certified by labour standards, and scores 11-20% in the Fashion Transparency Index. There is also no sufficient indication that Diesel systematically involves trade unions in its auditing system

philanthropy.info: OTB SpA donated 10% of its online sales to combat coronavirus in April 2020.

labour.info: The company source a lot of their cotton from Uzbekistan and Turkmenistan, who's governments forcibly mobilised over one million citizens to grow and harvest cotton, according to Anti-Slavery International (ASI). However, as of 2021, it's not expected that companies using organic cotton to have developed a policy on Uzbekistan cotton.
